title: Untitled
text:
A pilot and two children survived a crash landing on Alaska’s frozen Tustumena Lake after their plane went missing Sunday. They were spotted walking on the ice and rescued with only minor injuries.

The Piper PA-12 left Soldotna Airport for a sightseeing trip but never returned. Search teams and locals joined the effort, with a Good Samaritan spotting the wreckage and the survivors.

Rescuer Dale Eicher said: “I didn’t expect that we would find them alive for sure… it doesn’t always turn out this well.”

images.title: Blake, Wm. Tailpiece to The Eagle, Ballad the Second. 1802.
